author: manunlp
content:
I'm currently working on robust syncing. (Aka, the ability to sync in hard conditions, including for a full node that has **no** peers custodying some of its needed columns.)

In order to to that, it would be very helpful to request columns **by root** for finalized epochs.
Currently, the [specification](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/fulu/p2p-interface.md#datacolumnsidecarsbyroot-v1) does not allow that. (Thanks <@656728086410297356> for the heads up!).

> Clients MUST support requesting sidecars since minimum_request_epoch, where `minimum_request_epoch = max(finalized_epoch, current_epoch - MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_DATA_COLUMN_SIDECARS_REQUESTS, FULU_FORK_EPOCH)`. 

My question is: Would CL clients be OK to remove the `finalized_epoch` in the specification, to have:
> Clients MUST support requesting sidecars since minimum_request_epoch, where `minimum_request_epoch = max(current_epoch - MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_DATA_COLUMN_SIDECARS_REQUESTS, FULU_FORK_EPOCH)`. 


If no, why?
cc <@498331483732312075> <@466006586477772831> <@425907307621122049> <@785811170387951616> <@931591385545584640>

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
We are not following spec already (we follow what you want exactly), removing finalized support is in backlog.
On the question what should be in spec after all, I'm not sure. It was required to be supported with peer sampling, lossy sampling etc and it's not a strong requirement now. But we decided that some clients may want to have peer sampling etc. If we want to make it supported we should leave an ability to request finalized DataColumnSidecars by root in the spec like you propose. I'm neutral on this decision, beacuse we don't plan to do peer sampling
